page.title: 06Employment in Knockholt
page.content: Besides farms, stud farms and forestry there are many other forms of employment in Knockholt. There is a cattery, a kennels, an agricultural contractor (to serve the farms and machinery); there is a woodcraft industry and a blacksmith, who produces all sorts of wrought iron designs. Market gardening is in evidence, also plumbing and building. There is a fishman who sells fresh fish from a van. Game-keeping is much in evidence, especially around Chevening Park. Along the North Downs Way you can see and hear evidence of this, with notices asking you to keep your dog on a lead and wild upward rushes of pheasants and game birds when you approach their nesting areas. There are two public houses in Knockholt who do meals and employ several people.
